text.p: Belgian agricultural commodity company Sipef NV, which released on Wednesday its 1996 results showing an increase in profit to 235 million francs from 158 million, said it was upbeat on prospects for 1997.
"The positive evolution of, excluding rubber, commodity prices and the dollar should give us a favourable 1997," Sipef said in a statement.
Sipef noted it had recently expanded its businesses by acquiring interests in an Ivory Coast palm oil plantation, a new tea factory in Vietnam and saw mill in Papua New Guinea.

The firm said its results in Zaire were maintained despite the civil war raging in the east of the country. "The damage and destruction at our subsidiaries in Kivu is slight and does not threaten the continuation of our activities," it said.
-- Paul de Bendern, Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6816, Fax +32 2 230 7710
